Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hit a half-century in his first match as India's permanent T20I captain
Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal laid down a marker by scoring 74 runs in the first wicket stand
Sri Lanka lost nine wickets for 30 runs, conceding a game they would've backed themselves to win
Suryakumar was dismissed by Matheesha Pathirana
Pathirana led Sri Lanka's fightback by taking 4 wickets for 40 runs
Pathirana dismissed Suryakumar, Rishabh Pant, and Riyan Parag
Pathum Nissanka hit two sixes in the fourth over against Mohammed Siraj
Kamindu Mendis reverse-swept Arshdeep Singh for boundaries
Dasun Shanaka was run out off a run-out made possible by Siraj's athleticism
Parag sealed victory by dismissing Theekshana and Madushanka off successive deliveries
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill acknowledged the need to improve his T20I batting template
Shashank Kishore mentioned that India had just five bowling options
India's new opening partnership turned into a healthy contest of one-upmanship
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav's performance was crucial in India's win
India's new T20I era under Suryakumar Yadav began on a winning note
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka had nine wickets in hand but still needed 74 off 36
Nissanka was reprieved a ball earlier by Ravi Bishnoi at deep midwicket
Suryakumar hit a second-fastest half-century in T20Is off just 22 balls
Axar Patel dismissed Suryakumar off a low-arm slinger as they missed full balls
Parag justified his selection by giving away only five runs at a crunch moment
